column4: Is there an IRC client installed by default with Ubuntu? Can't seem to find it. I'm used to Xchat but all I see in Synaptic is some ripoff called "xchat-gnome"
you can install the regular xchat.. sudo apt-get install xchat
xchat should be in the "Applications" menu.. under "Internet"
hmm.. well.. try pressing alt+f2 then.. write "xchat" there
open a terminal, type "sudo apt-get install xchat", if that doesn't give you any errors try looking in the menus again
BTW I cannot do SU -l in my terminal, it's not accepting the same password i use for sudo. What's up with that? Is there a default SU password?
well.. since ubuntu doesn't really use the root password.. su is bad..
if you really really really (and even if you get this far, think again) need su.. you can use "sudo -i"
and now the shortcut is available in the "Internet" menu?
then I can go to bed and sleep well, knowing we've solved that little problem =)
